fields.name: IEX - When IOC faults (Manual reset) are triggered and Power cycle is performed, Faults are cleared after power up
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - When IOC faults (Manual reset) are triggered and Power cycle is performed, Faults are cleared after power up

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

 

Drive type:

Monarch and Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad hoc

 

Test step number:

Ad hoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. When Escalator is running, IOC Manual reset fault is activated (eg 19-1 (Flywheel monitor)
  2. once FC is posted in FUI, turn off simulator immediately.
  3. Now restore the Fault condition input and turn on simulator
  4. When the simulator is turned on, No faults are present in FUI and Escalator runs with Key switch.

 

Expected behavior:  

FC must be active in FUI

 

Actual behavior:

No faults are present in FUI and Escalator runs with Key switch.
fields.BUG_RD_comments$154:
[Visu]: 20-Jan-2025

Switch activation time to be measured

 

[Sultan 23.01.2024]:

The reaction time was measured for the above scenario. 

Time observed : 1.642 secs

 

[Visu]: 
Defect Review meeting: 
Date: 23-Jan-2025
Participants: Lido, Visu, Pramod, Srinath, Banu

 

Not  critical for piloting, improvement to be done later releases.

 

[Pradeep Kumar]:23/10/2025

"This fault can be reproduced by activating the simulator switch. However, if the simulator is turned off immediately after the fault count F1 appears on the FUI display, the fault does not reappear after a power cycle. It seems that the power was turned off before the flash write operation was completed. When the simulator remains ON until the fault code is fully displayed on the FUI, the fault is retained correctly. Hence, this is considered a lower-priority defect."

 

[Visu]: 10-Nov-2025
Defect Review meeting
Participants: Visu, Banu

 

This is very rare case, if really happened no risk for the passenger, to be planned in HD

fields.BUG_rootCause$154: Coding error. Digital outputs from the Shift registers are over writing the LED's functionality.
fields.BUG_RD_comments$154:
[Satish]: 17-Jun-2025:

This defect has been fixed and will be released in R3.0.0.2

 

[Gopi]: 1-Jul-2025
This defect is fixed in R 3.0.0.2

 

[Bhavya]: 01-Aug-2025

This defect is verified in R3.0.0.2 and it found ok.

 

[Srinath S]: 28-Nov-2025

after discussion with Muppadi Sathish, we understand the purpose of these LEDs D105 and D106 are meant to be in OFF state during inverter mode and only works(ON) in star-delta for respective directions. But our only concern is that, on the board, beside these LEDs the label is printed as UP_RUN and  DOWN_RUN. This might give confusion for anyone uses these diagnostic LEDs like for example production tester, etc, while running in inverter mode.
hence we can close this defect if no other concern or comments from anyone else.

fields.name: IEX - Escalator does not recover when CPU Software is updated and system restart command is given
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - Escalator does not recover when CPU Software is updated and system restart command is given

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

 

Drive type:

Monarch & Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad hoc

 

Test step number:

Ad hoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. IEX Controller is in ready state with no FC in FUI
  2. Change the CPU SW alone (using pro manager and Segger)
  3. After uploading the Software, Pro manager displays as "System restart required"
  4. Give yes and restart the controller
  5. Now, after SRST and Node pairing, FUI shows Fault codes (Truss heating, IOC Communication)
  6. Now try to push safety parameter by PC1_1901_1, Unable to push the parameters (the value in PC1_1901_1 is blinking)
  7. Now, if we power off the whole system and power on again, the system recovers.

 

Expected behavior:  

The Controller should not get hanged after CPU software upload

 

Actual behavior:

The controller gets hanged after CPU SW upload

 

Recovery: 

Power cycle

fields.name: IEX - Manual reset faults created - Escalator moved to inspection mode, the FC ceared are not posted again when inspection mode is turned off
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - Manual reset faults created - Escalator moved to inspection mode, the FC cleared are not posted again when inspection mode is turned off.

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

 

Drive type:

Monarch & Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad hoc

 

Test step number:

Ad hoc

 

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • Escalator is running in star delta KCM
  • Now, FC 58 (breaking distance too long) is created.
  • Remove the inspection blind plug
  • ESC is in inspection mode, FC is still active.
  • now try to run the escalator, Escalator runs
  • FC gets cleared.
  • Now stop the escalator and come out of inspection mode.
  • Blind plug is closed, Esc is in normal mode (KCM)
  • FC 58 is not posted.

 

Note: The same behavior is observed for all manual reset faults + inspection supervision: NO

 

Expected behavior:  

FC 58 must be posted.

 

Actual behavior:

FC 58 is not posted.
fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
Coding error: While Key start, MSC will send faults clear command by activating manual reset button to all connected nodes in safety bus. Originally this change is needed for LSC and SEC only. Since, common bit is used, CPU also acting on this common bit change which is clearing the existing manual reset faults.

Corrective action:

In MSC, Instead of common bit, dedicated separate bit is used to send fault clear info which can be used by LSC and SEC only. CPU will not have any impact on this bit change.

fields.name: IEX - Parameters locking feature: Parameters are locked even after changing CPU SW.
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - IEX - Parameters locking feature: Parameters are locked even after changing CPU SW. 

 

Parameters:  

PC2_2912 (Parameters locking)

 

Drive type:

Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Parameters Access Locking in FUI

 

Test step number:

13

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. The controller is uploaded with latest SW version TR 1.0 t12.11 & No faults are active in FUI
  2. Now, lock the parameters by PC2_2912_1
  3. Verify if the parameters are locked by writing any value in PC1.1202
  4. Not able to access the parameters
  5. Now upload t12.10 cpu sw
  6. Again uploaded t12.11 cpu sw and clear all faults
  7. Now try to write any value in parameter PC1.1201
  8. Parameters are still locked.
  9. PC2_2912 value is 1

 

Note: I have tried degrading the CPU SW: Tr 1.0 t12.10, t12.9, t12.8, t12.7

Parameters were still locked.

 

Observed this scenario only one time while testing SW T1.0 t12.11

 

Frequency: 

 

Expected behavior:  

Parameters are unlocked after changing the CPU SW

 

Actual behavior:

Parameters are locked even after changing the CPU SW

1.Select parameter PC4-4300 = 1 (Overspeed Test 1 without Aux Brake)

fields.name: FC 322.12 (Node pairing "Pairing check failed" - LSC) is created by swapping LSC board, when boards are unswapped FC 322.12 is not cleared but escalator runs with FC active in FUI
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

FC 322.12 (Node pairing "Pairing check failed" - LSC) is created by swapping LSC board, when boards are unswapped FC 322.12 is not cleared but escalator runs with FC active in FUI

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

 

Drive type:

NA

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad hoc

 

Test step number:

Ad hoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

1. LCB board paired with controllers Simu 316 & 179
2. LCB boards swapped
3. FC 348-1 (Node pairing "Pairing check failed" - LCB) & FC 322.12 (Node pairing "Pairing check failed" - LSC) posted
4. Now unswap the boards to original position
5. FC 322.12 (Node pairing "Pairing check failed" - LSC) is posted in FUI
6. FC 322.12 is not cleared by key start or manual reset
7. Escalator starts to run with key switch but FC is still active in FUI
8. Power cycle - FC 322.12 got cleared.

 

Note: This defect can be re simulated every time

 

Expected behavior:  

FC 322.12 must be cleared when boards are unswapped

 

Actual behavior:

FC 322.12 is not cleared when boards are unswapped

 

Recovery: 

Power cycle

Ad hoc

Ad Hoc

  1. Start the escalator with Key switch in KAM or K2D Mode in UP / Down Direction
  2. After Normal Running time the Escalator decelerates to stop.
  3. before the escalator comes to a complete stop cut the P1 Photocell

only observed in Danfoss Drive with Dynamic Brakes enabled.

Escalator stops with FC 74 (Braking sequence timeout fault)

Manual Reset

fields.name: IEX-Acceleration Rate fluctuates on the RTD display when the escalator is in running condition.
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX-Acceleration Rate fluctuates on the RTD display when the escalator is in running condition.

 

Parameters:  

PC5_5100_11

 

Group configuration:

Single setup

 

Drive type:

Danfoss, Monarch

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

RTD Display

 

Test step number:

11

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

1.Start the escalator in the UP direction.
2.The escalator starts to run in the UP direction.
3.Set parameter PC5_5100_11 and check RTD and monitor the acceleration rate status.
4.Even after the escalator reaches a stable running state, the acceleration rate continues to fluctuate.

Note: This issue was observed both in Danfoss and Monarch drive.

 

Expected behavior:  

Once the escalator reaches a stable running speed, the acceleration rate should remain constant.

 

Actual behavior:

Even after the escalator reaches a stable running state, the acceleration rate continues to change, indicating unexpected behavior.

 

Recovery: 

No

SW-TR1.0-t12.13

IEX - In K2D mode, photocell stop condition - 'Escalator in up / down running, please hold on handrail and stand inside yellow line & You are approaching exit, be careful is announced in ACU

 

Parameters:  

PC1_1200_1 (passenger announcement selection - 1 - Announcement during Nominal speed, Standby speed, Photocell stop)

PC3_3007_1 (B+D)

New Finding

Ad hoc

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. Escalator is in K2D mode
  2. Now start the escalator in any direction, after nominal speed expiry the escalator will stop in photocell stop
  3. Now observe the ACU messages:
  4. The ACU still says:
    1. Escalator in up / down running, please hold on handrail and stand inside yellow line

fields.name: IEX-RTD displays incorrect Motor Power and Voltage value during Escalator running operation.
fields.description:
IEX-RTD displays incorrect Motor Power and Voltage value during Escalator running operation.

 

Parameters:  

PC5_5100_7

PC5_5100_8

 

Group configuration:

Single setup.

 

Drive type:

Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

RTD Display

 

Test step number:

8,9

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) :
Motor POWER:

1.Set Parameter PC5_5100_7 (Motor Power).
2.Start the escalator using the key switch in the UP direction.
3.The escalator starts to run in UP direction.

4.Check the RTD display status of motor power.
3.Motor power was updated incorrectly .[ since Motor power has 7.5KW but in RTD is showing 77KW ] 

MOTOR VOLTAGE:

1.Set Parameter PC5_ 5100_8 (Motor Voltage)
2.Start the escalator using the key switch in the UP direction.
3.The escalator starts to run in UP direction.

4.Check the RTD display status of motor voltage.
3.Motor voltage was updated incorrectly .[ For motor voltage, RTD is showing 3725 V]

 

Note: Observed in all operational modes: KCM,KAM,KST,KSB and K2D.

          Observed only in Danfoss drive.

          AMC tool also displays same as RTD value.

 

Expected behavior:  

The motor power value displayed on the RTD should be updated correctly based on motor power and motor voltage rating.

 

Actual behavior:

The motor power value on the RTD display shows 77 KW, which is incorrect and significantly higher than the value of 7.5 KW and also for motor voltage, RTD is showing as 3725 V.

 

Recovery: 

No

 

Value-added information: 

SW-TR1.0-t12.13

fields.name: IEX-CPU Reboot issue in 601CPU (Version G01) during running in Star-Delta Operation.
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX-CPU Reboot issue in 601CPU (Version G01) during running in Star-Delta Operation.

 

Parameters:  

-

 

Group configuration:

Single Escalator setup

 

Drive type:

Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

1.Escalator is running in Normal mode in star-delta operation

2.During continuous running, the CPU gets rebooted immediately with fault 104 -2 (Safety bus Communication fault- MSC Supervision)

 

Expected behavior:  

The escalator should run continuously in Normal mode with star-delta operation without any interruption or system faults. 

 

Actual behavior:

During continuous operation in Normal mode (star-delta operation), the 601CPU (version G01) unexpectedly reboots with Fault 104-2: Safety Bus Communication Fault - MSC Supervision.

 

Note:

The issue was observed 5 times within one hour.

The reboot issue is not present during inverter operation.

The issue occurrence is repeatable, but the frequency of occurrence is a bit wider, while keeping the escalator running. But, peculiarly observed that, when AMC is connected with the CPU, and operations are done with AMC, the reboot feels to be reproduced more frequently.

No issue observed in G95 and G99.

 

Recovery: 

No

 

Value-added information: 

SW version details:

KIE601-CPU KM51756364G01 002 1 Release-TR1.0 t12.13
KIE601 CPU SW -Ver 1.24.0.0

KIE601 IOC -Ver 0.24.0.0

KIE601 SEC - Ver 0.27.0

fields.name: IEX - FC 302 is cleared When Escalator is running in learning mode & interrupted by removing inspection blind plug
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - FC 302 is cleared When Escalator is running in learning mode & interrupted by removing inspection blind plug

 

Parameters:  

PC4_4000 (Learning)

 

Group configuration:

NA

 

Drive type:

Monarch & Danfoss

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad hoc

 

Test step number:

Ad hoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. Create FC 302
  2. Now initiate Learning by Parameter PC4_4000_1
  3. Give Key switch input, Escalator starts running
  4. Now, interrupt the Escalator running by removing Inspection blind plug
  5. Escalator stops with Upper FUI = 'Lear_' & Lower FUI = "_ _ _ _"
  6. FC 302 is cleared.
  7. Close the inspection blind plug and give key start
  8. Escalator runs normally in operational mode

 

Expected behavior:  

FC 302 must not be cleared

 

Actual behavior:

FC 302 is cleared

 

Recovery: 

Again, Power cycle - FC 302 is posted again
fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
PRAKASH K

Root Cause: Coding Error

when learning was interrupted (switching to inspection mode), the learning status was not set to PENDING, so the learning fault (302)cleared. The fix makes sure any interruption sets the status to PENDING, so the fault stays active until learning is completed.

fields.name: IEX - Interlock communication fault is posted FC 323-2 & 323-3 (Interlock Communication fault, Escalator) when Learning is initiated in master escalator (Escalators are connected in Interlock)
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - Interlock communication fault is posted FC 323 when Learning is initiated (Escalators are connected in Interlock)

 

Parameters:  

PC1_1401_3 (Interlock group size)

PC2_2110_1/2/3 (Escalator ID to be set)

PC2_2111_1 (Interlock Safety Enabled)

 

 

Drive type:

Monarch

 

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Interlock feature 1

 

Test step number:

7

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. Three Escalators are connected in interlock
  2. Now Learning is initiated in one of the escalators, other escalators are in stopped idle condition. (Master escalator)
  3. After Learning is completed, The other two escalators post FC 323-2 in ESC 2, FC 323-3 in ESC 3

 

Expected behavior:  

Interlock safety must not be posted

 

Actual behavior:

FC 323 is posted after learning completed

 

Recovery: 

Manual Reset
fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
[SIVA KUMAR M]: 07-Nov-2025

Coding error.

Initializes UART3 to receive data via DMA into a u8InterlockRecvBuf buffer, When the UART DMA reception fails, aborts any active DMA transfer to ensure a clean state.

Test step number:

Ad hoc

  1. Escalators are running in Interlock
  2. suddenly master escalator stops with no FC
  3. After some time, interlock communication faults are posted FC 323-2, 323-3

Escalators must not be stopped

 

Actual behavior:

Recovery: 

manual reset
fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
[SIVA KUMAR M]: 07-Nov-2025

Instead of using the u16MiParamEscalatorIdInInterlock (from the MIP parameter value) used the u8InterlockEscalatorId (from Response frame from CPU - Byte 15) and also used u8InterlockGroupSize instead of u16ParamInterlockGroupSize.

Corrective action done:

Using the u16MiParamEscalatorIdInInterlock and u8InterlockEscalatorId - from MIP parameter value.

This is already fixed in IT release R 3.0.1.2 along with SWBUG-2670.
fields.BUG_RD_comments$154:
[Satish]: 29-10-2025:

As we discussed, please re-test this scenario again by maintaining proper cabling and termination resisters.

 

[Satish]: 8-Nov-2025:

This defect root cause is similar to SWBUG-2670. It is fixed in R 3.0.1.2 and improvements are done along with SWBUG-2693. This defect can be verified in R 3.0.1.4 

 

[Krishna]: 22-Nov-2025

This defect is tested in R3.0.1.4 release with 6 days of continuous testing interlocking of 4 simulator and issue not found, It seems okay

fields.name: IEX - Escalator not running in interlock mode after learning is initiated in 3rd simulator
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

IEX - Escalator not running in interlock mode after learning is initiated in 3rd simulator. Safety relay is chattering

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

 

Drive type:

Monarch

 

Regression or new finding:

New Finding

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Test case

 

Test step number:

15

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. 3 Escalators are connected in interlock
  2. No FC is displayed in FUI
  3. Now, 3rd escalator (topmost) learning is initiated by Parameter PC4_4000_1
  4. after learning gets completed, all FC is cleared.
  5. Now. Down key switch input is given in bottom most escalator (ESC 1)
  6. Esc does not run, safety relay chatters.
  7. No FC is posted in FUI

Note: Logs are attached in the attachments section

 

Expected behavior: 

Escalator must run in interlock

 

Actual behavior:

Escalator does not run

 

Recovery: 

Power cycle
fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
Root cause:

Instead of using the u16MiParamEscalatorIdInInterlock (from the MIP parameter value) used the u8InterlockEscalatorId (from Response frame from CPU - Byte 15) and also used u8InterlockGroupSize instead of u16ParamInterlockGroupSize.

Corrective action done:

Using the u16MiParamEscalatorIdInInterlock and u8InterlockEscalatorId - from MIP parameter value.
fields.BUG_RD_comments$154:
[satish]: 17-Nov-2025:

This defect observation is same as KIE601-SWBUG-2635. It is fixed in R 3.0.1.1. So this defect is to be reverified in R3.0.1.1 or later releases.

fields.description:

PC1 - 1248_1

 

 

Drive type:

 

Danfoss and Monarch

1 The escalator is in normal mode

2 Set parameter PC1 - 1248_1(ELink Selection)

3 Now, run the escalator UP/DOWN direction

4 During running, create fault 355 (Communication fault, E Link) 

5 with the fault activated, when trying to run the escalator in inspection mode, 

Inspection mode running is not possible in any direction 

 

Note: with fault 355, a normal run is possible 

 

Expected behavior:  

 

with fault 355 (Communication fault, E Link) escalator should run in inspection mode

 

Actual behavior:

 

With the fault-activated condition, when trying to run the escalator in inspection mode, unable to run

 

Recovery: 

 

If we disable the parameter PC1-1248_0. Then Inspection run is possible

single elevator setup

fields.name: DCS 2.7 - KNSMUL K-COP: WHEN DOB/DCB STUCK CONDITION ,NUDGING CLOSES THE DOOR , ONCE THE DRIVE STARTS RELEASE DOB/DCB  BACKLIGHT  NOT TURNED OFF
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

In DCS 2.7 - KNSMUL K-COP, when the Door Open Button (DOB) or Door Close Button (DCB) is stuck, the nudging feature closes the door as expected. However, once the drive starts and the DOB/DCB button is released, the backlight does not turn OFF. The backlight remains ON until the lift reaches the next floor.

 

Parameters:  

1_13_1(nudging)

1_61_29(or)30 

 

Group configuration:

3 car group (1 real and 2 table simulator used)

 

Drive type:

KDM40 - 6

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

KNSMUL - Functionality of DOB DCB DOE

 

Test step number:

11

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

1. In DCS 2.7 - KNSMUL K-COP, press and hold the DOB or DCB button.


2. Ensure the button gets stuck (simulating a stuck condition).


3. Due to nudging, the door starts closing automatically.


4. The lift starts moving.


5. Release the DOB/DCB button while the lift is in motion.


6. Observe that the DOB/DCB backlight remains ON instead of turning OFF.


7. The backlight only turns OFF when the lift reaches the next floor.

 

 

Expected behavior:  

 

Once the drive starts, releasing the DOB/DCB should immediately turn OFF the backlight.

The backlight should not remain ON unnecessarily during the lift’s movement.

 

Actual behavior:

 

Backlight of DOB/DCB remains ON even after the drive starts.

The light turns OFF only when the lift reaches the next floor, instead of turning OFF immediately when released.

 

Recovery: 

(e.g. Can issue be recovered by performing some actions like power break / RDF / Parameter changes)

fields.name: LCE 10.3.15 - KNSMUL/KSSMUL -FEX  Button Car Call Registration Buzzer Does Not Sound When Speaker is Connected Only to Main MUL Board
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

FEX Button Car Call Registration Buzzer Does Not Sound When Speaker Is Connected Only to Main MUL Board

 

Parameters:  

 

Car Call Registration Buzzer 1_42_ 0 (OFF) or 1(ON) or 2 (EN - 81)  

 

Group configuration:

single elevator setup

 

Drive type:

KDM90

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

KNSMUL - Car Call Functionality for 126 Floors with FEX Button

 

Test step number:

9

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

In a configuration with two MUL boards—one handling buttons 1–63 and the other handling only the FEX button—the call registration buzzer works only on the MUL board where the speaker is physically connected. The buzzer sound is not shared across both MUL boards as expected.

 

Scenario 1:

 

Enable Parameter 1_42_0 (OFF)

 

Setup:

 

MUL 1: Buttons 1 to 63, Speaker connected.

MUL 2: FEX Button only, No speaker 


Steps to Reproduce:

 

1. Connect two MUL boards:

MUL 1 with buttons 1–63.

MUL 2 with FEX button only.

 

2. Connect speaker only to MUL 1.


3. Press buttons 1–63 → Observe speaker beeps.


4. Press FEX button → No beep.


5. Swap speaker to MUL 2.


6. Press FEX button → Beep works.


7. Press buttons 1–63 → No beep.

 

Scenario 2:

 

Enable Parameter 1_42_ 1 (or) 2

 

Setup:

 

MUL 1: Buttons 1 to 63, Speaker connected.

MUL 2: FEX Button only, No speaker 


Steps to Reproduce:

 

1. Connect two MUL boards:

 

MUL 1 with buttons 1–63.

MUL 2 with FEX button only.

 

2. Connect speaker only to MUL 1.

 

3. Press buttons 1–63 → Observe speaker beeps, Dual Beep sound will generate to indicate the car call registration.

 

4. Press FEX button → Single beep sound observed

 

 

Scenario 3:

 

MUL 1: Buttons 1 to 63, Speaker connected.

MUL 2: FEX Button only, Speaker Connected


Steps to Reproduce:

 

1. Connect two MUL boards:

MUL 1 with buttons 1–63.

MUL 2 with FEX button only.

 

2. Connect speakers  to MUL 1&2.


3. Press buttons 1–63 → Observe speaker beeps in both MUL 1 and 2 connected speakers.

 

Mul1 - Dual beep sound observed.

Mul 2- Single Beep Sound observed.


4. Press FEX button → Observe speaker beeps in both MUL 1 and 2 connected speakers.

 

Mul1 - Dual beep sound observed.

Mul 2- Single Beep Sound observed.

 

Note: 3 Beep sounds are observed if we connect speakers at both MUL  and MUL2

 


 

Expected behavior:  

Buzzer sound should occur for all button presses, regardless of which MUL board the button belongs to, using the speaker connected on either board.

 

Actual behavior:

Buzzer sound works only for the buttons handled by the MUL board where the speaker is connected. Other button presses do not produce any sound.

 

 

Value-added information: 

 

CPU SW - 10.3.15

KNSMUL SW - AS 39 SS21

Drive - KDM 90

Floor Configuration - 80 Floors

car call and Landing call locking should be disabled.

fields.BUG_rootCause$154: There was no requirement to disable CDI if car or landing call locking was disabled. This is needed because when FPD is enabled, landing call locks have to be enabled in call locking logic - despite the landing call lock parameter 1006 setting.

fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

P4.2 - Landing call Acceptance light (all floors) +Car call Acceptance Light(lower) is not blinking to indicate the readiness for reset.

Safety Parameter

  • Toggle L2 input (ON-OFF)
  • FC 1039-2 will active
  • Landing call Acceptance light (all floors) +Car call Acceptance Light(lower) will blink

Actual behavior:

Landing call Acceptance light (all floors) +Car call Acceptance Light(lower) only blinks when L3 is set to ON.

NA

fields.description:

In EAQ Stuck Moment- ACU announces both "EAQ Evocation Statement" and followed by the "Emergency Stuck Announcement" .

1501 - 0 ---->Lift stuck emergency voice announcer should be Disabled

1466 - 1 ----> ACU lift stuck announcement

  • Activate the EAQ mode through OPT -39 (DIP-00100111) First Input(S1).

Simplex

 

Drive type:

KDX32

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) :

  • LD : 16.4.1.11
  • GCD : 16.4.65

 

  • D10 EVO 
  • Serial Communication

 

  • Door SW = 3.3A

 

  • A side Door : STM32L412RB 
  • B side Door : STM32f103RB

 

  • 10 Floor Setup

 

  • This case is checked initially with Door Motion Profile (Parameter 616) = 100 for all floors

 

Scenario:

1. Elevator is standing in floor level, with Doors open

2. Door reaches the Open end,

3. Reference switch magnet is short circuited to generate the close end signal

4. Door tries to Open, Since Close limit is thrown - Fault 1614 is thrown

5. Door again Closes and Open again 

6. Fault 1614 is thrown again and Doors are left Open

7. Lift gone Out Of Service

 

 

Expected behavior:  

As per test case KCE-TSTRN-3824480

  • After making Close End Stuck
  • Reference switch error shall get activated ,
  • After that Encoder position generates the close end signal immediately
  • which prevents elevator going to "out of service"

 

 

Actual behavior:

  • Elevator goes Out of Service with FC 1614 (Faults are not automatically cleared)

 

Log attached Information:

  • Elevator Backup
  • Event Traffic
  • LPA

fields.name: P4.2 - NHR- CTD Reset - Step 4 - DOB is not blinking in KCE COB
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

CTD reset is in step 4, DOB is not blinking in KCE COB (KDS Signalization)

 

Parameters:  

SP: 6034-3

      6035-0

 

Group configuration:

Single Elevator setup

CPU LD: 16.10.0.15

MSC: 4.2.0.2

 

Drive type:

KDM 90

SW: 25.11

 

Regression or new finding:

Regression

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

KCECPU - Indication via DOB and COP Buzzer - CTD Reset - KCECOB 

 

Test step number:

Step 4

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

Execute CTD reset sequence:

 

1. While Car Top Detection is in detection phase (Step1)

     FC 1427-1 is in active

 

2. Reset the Car Top detection with Step2 procedure:
    2.1 Open safety input S1 / Push down, Car Top Inspection STOP button
    2.2 Toggle / Open-Close safety input C4 (stop switch on car roof)

   

    FC 1427-2 is updated, short beep from COP buzzer

 

3. Reset the Car Top detection with Step3 procedure:

    3.1 Close Person On Car Roof / C3 input
    3.2 Close safety input S1 / release Up Car Top Inspection STOP button
    3.3 Close Inner Ceiling / C7 input

   

   FC 1427-3 is updated and short beep from COP buzzer

 

4. Reset the Car Top detection with Step4, pressing of DOB
    4.1 Press COP's blinking DOB

(for TTC, both DOBs will blink but pressing one button shall be enough)

 

 

Expected behavior:  

In Sequence 4, Door Open Button/s (DOB) should start to blink with ~1sec. interval.

 

Actual behavior:

DOB is not blinking with KCE COB, but pressing of DOB, reset the CTD. 

 

Recovery: 

NA

 

Log attached Information:

Event Traffic

 

Value-added information: 

Working fine in KSS LMUL

Not working in KCE COB (KDS)

fields.name: 16.8 - FRD AU - Elevator doesn't go back to normal mode from Phase 2, When 1432 is set as '0'
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

In FRD AU, When 1432 is set as '0', 
Elevator doesn't goes back to normal mode from Phase 2,

 

Parameters:  

  • 1420 - 1
  • 1421 - 1
  • 1428 - 5s
  • 1432 - 0s
  • 1442 - 19 (Australia)

 

 

Group configuration:

  • Simplex

 

Drive type:

  • KDM 40

 

Regression or new finding:

  • New Finding, Ad-Hoc

 

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • FRD is triggered from Landing
  • Elevator reached return Floor
  • In CAR FRD Switch activated elevator went to Phase 2 
     

or

 

  • Just In-CAR Switch is turned ON to get to Phase 2 without initiating Phase 1 from Landing
  • After turning off FRD In-CAR Switch, Elevator not changed to Normal Mode

 

Expected behavior:  

  • With 1432 - 0s, 
  • Elevator should change form Phase 2 to Normal mode instantly, after Turning OFF FRD input from OPT


 

Actual behavior:

  • Lift stays in FRD Phase 2 Forever.

 

Recovery: 

  • Only when 1432 parameter is changed to OTHER THAN '0'

 

NOTE:

 

  • After setting FRD Country Code to AU(19), Automatic Parameter Updation via SW sets 1432 to 3 seconds,
  • When 1432 - 3, Phase 2 turns to normal as per the Timeout
  • This FRD AU Phase 2 Stuck scenario happens only when 1432 parameter is Manually set to 0

 

 

Log attached Information:

  • Elevator Event Traffic
  • Elevator Backup
  • LPA Log​​​

 

Value-added information: 

 

-HW versions - OPT 35

-Types of Signalization  - KSSMUL 

-Door module types - AMD D15 Parallel

-is problem validated in other simulators - YES

fields.name: 16.8 - KCEDCS - Conflicts in OSS and CAM reservation at the same time in xDOP via Pincode.
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

The CAM mode is not released when OSS is released from the xDOP

 

Parameters:  

(e.g. Parameter X (Description of the parameter) - parameter value)

 

Group configuration:

Fourplex

 

Drive type:

KDL16 24.13

 

Regression or new finding:

New

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

ad-hoc defect

 

Test step number:

“ad-hoc scenario”

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • Reserve the lift into CAM mode in xDOP via pin on any floor (ex., Floor 10)
  • Lift Reaches to CAM floor (ex., Floor 10) and stays in CAM mode
  • Reserve the same lift for OSS mode in xDOP via pin on any floor (ex., Floor 14)
  • The xDOP puts a "try again" message - But the lift reserved for OSS goes to the OSS reserved floor. (ex., Floor 14)
  • Now unreserve the lift from OSS (ex., Floor 14) - OSS unreserved successfully
  • Then the lift goes to CAM floor (ex., Floor 10)
  • Now unreserve the lift from CAM mode - CAM mode unreserved message displayed in xDOP but still the lift is in reserved state.

 

Expected behavior:  

The Lift should come out from the CAM mode.

 

Actual behavior:

The lift doesn't come out from the CAM mode.

 

Recovery: 

KCECPUc Restart (Not manual)

 

 

Log attached Information:

Node debug, xDOP and Event Traffic

fields.name: 16.8 - FRD - Buzzer keeps Shouting even after reaching Evacuation Floor when ACL is enabled
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

16.8 - FRD - Buzzer keeps on Shouting even after reaching Evacuation Floor when ACL is enabled

 

Parameters:  

 

 

 

 

Group configuration:

Single

 

Drive type:

KDL 16S

 

Regression or new finding:

Ad-HOC

 

 

Description:

 

  • LD : 16.8.3.14
  • 12 Floor Setup
  • TTC, Staggered, Dummy
  • KCE KDL 16S
  • KNSMUL G24

 

Elevator in Non-Evacuation Floor

  • FRD Phase 1 Input from Landing (OPT) is triggered
  • Phase 1 drive starts
  • Buzzer starts shouting till reaching Evac floor
  • ACL happens due to mismatch in floor level
  • After ACL Buzzer keeps on Shouting and doesn't turns OFF even after elevator turns to NORMAL Mode

 

NOTE:

  • Checked with 16.4 & 16.6 same issue noted
  • This happens only when ACL happens
  • This issue is noted in FRD Countries like BELGIUM, AUSTRALIA

 

 

Expected behavior:  

  • Buzzer should turn off after reaching Evac Floor and when doors are opened

 

Actual behavior:

  • Even after ACL happens, Buzzer shouldn't turn ON

 

Recovery: 

  • Phase 1 input needs to be triggered once and back to NC to turn OFF the buzzer

 

 

Log attached Information:

  • LPA
  • Elevator Event Traffic
  • Elevator backup

 

Value-added information: 

-HW versions - OPT 35

-Types of Signalization used - KNSMUL G24

-Door module types - AMD D10

-is problem validated in other simulators - YES

fields.name: 16.10 - FID M - Buzzer not Shouting while returning to FID Evacuation Floor after disabling FRD Phase 2, NZ
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

16.10 - FID - Buzzer not Shouting while returning to FID Evacuation Floor

 

Parameters:  

 

Group configuration:

Simplex

 

Drive type:

KCE KDL 16S 

 

Regression or new finding:

Ad-HOC

 

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

  • FRD Country code - NewZealand NZ, 21
  • OPT 35
  • KNSMUL G24​​​​​​ (A & B) side​
  • 12 floor setup
  • TTC, Single, Dummy floors
  • KCE KDL 16S

 

  • Elevator in floor other than FID Return Floor
  • Initially FRD Phase 1 is triggered from Landing (OPT)
  • Just while travelling FID M is triggered (NO from OPT input 4) shortly & made NC again
  • Elevator slows down to nearby floor & travels to FID Return Floor (Main Floor - 4th floor)
  • After serving FID Return floor, Elevator starts travelling back to FRD Return floor (1st floor )
  • After changing directly to FRD Phase 2, FRD Input 1 is made NC & FID M is made NO
  • While Travelling again to FID Return Floor Buzzer is not shouted

 

Expected behavior:  

  • Buzzer should shout when elevator driving to FID Evacuation floor

 

Actual behavior:

  • Buzzer not shouted in FID Returning Phase

 

Log attached Information:

LPA
Event Traffic

Elevator Backup

-Types of Signalization - KNSMUL G24

-Door module types - AMD D10

-any special boards used  - OPT 35

fields.name: 16.10 - OSI - Out of Service Output indication shown inversely in Service Tool's LON Node Network
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

OSI A output is shown inversely in Service tool's LON Structure

 

Parameters:  

1471 - 1

 

Group configuration:

Simplex

 

Drive type:

KCEKDL 16S

 

Regression or new finding:

AdHoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

​​​​​​

  • KCECPUc SW -  16.10.0.100(LD: 16.10.0.23, GCD: 16.10.10.13)
  • OPT 35A & 41A is used
  • 12 Floor Setup
  • KNSMUL G24

 

  • Any Out of Service scenario like Test Switch triggering causes OSI_A indication from  OPT's 7th Output - 
  • Active when elevator is in normal mode.
  • NOT active when elevator is out of normal service.
  • This function is working Correctly in Landing OPTs
  • But in Service Tool the output is shown oppositely

 

 

Expected behavior:  

Output should correspond to the OPT's Output

 

 

Actual behavior:

​

1. 263 Test Switch is Disabled

Output 7 (OSI_A) is Shown OFF, But in OPT 7th output is Turned ON

 

 

 

2. 263 Test Switch is Enabled

Output 7 (OSI_A) is Shown ON, But in OPT 7th output is Turned OFF

 

 

​

NOTE:

The OSI_A indication from OPT is working Fine as per the testcase, Just in Service Tool's UI, this issue is noted
 

Requirement related to the defect:

Since OSI A works inversely (ref:KCE-SWTC-1044)

fields.BUG_rootCause$154:
Preferred values is used to show all four decimals of MCU, INU and ISU version. MCU software version is shown in parameter as one number, example 2523, and that is not listed into preferred values. Added this as last item to the preferred values and it seems still readable. Better to have it in the listing to avoid red "invalid value" showing which would cause more confusion and questions.

Screenshot how fixed:

fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

 

AMD D200 – Door fails to respond to AMC commands after 3 open/close cycles in Service Mode

Note: D200 functions supported on Service Tool 4.6.

 

AMD D200 SW version 25.22.4.0

 

Parameters:  

 

-

 

Group configuration:

 

Single 

 

Drive type:

 

KDM

 

Regression or new finding:

 

New finding

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

 

 

 

 

Test step number:

 

KCE-SWTC-74017

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

  • Initiate the Open and Close door commands via the AMC tool in Service Mode.

  • Repeat the open/close operation three times.

  • Observe the system behavior after the third cycle.

can able to operative with service Buttons in service drive mode 

 

Expected behavior:  

 

The door should continue to open and close in response to the "Open" and "Close" commands issued via the AMC tool in Service Mode, regardless of the number of cycles.

 

Actual behavior:

 

  • After three open/close sequences, the door stops responding to further commands issued via the AMC tool in Service Mode.

  • However, the door can still be operated using the service buttons in Service Drive Mode.

 

 

Recovery: 

 

  • Disconnect and reconnect the AMC tool.

  • After reconnection, the door resumes responding to the open/close commands via AMC.

 

Log attached Information:

 

 

 

Recovery: 

Disconnect the AMC & reconnect , then only we can able to access the open & close command via AMC.

fields.description:

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

1. Turn on Inspection mode 

2. Press the learn button in Door module

3. Try to learn the door via AMC 

 

Expected behavior:  

  • The door learning process should be completed within 2–3 open/close cycles initiated via the AMC tool.

  • Door speed should vary appropriately during the learning phase

 

Actual behavior:

  • The learning is not completed via AMC.

  • The door speed remains constant across all cycles, and the state LED stays continuously ON.

  • Attempting to perform learning using Open/Close service buttons while AMC is connected also fails — the door does not respond.

  • Only after disconnecting the AMC from the door module and then using the service buttons, the door learning process completes successfully.

D200 usb communication works fine when doing sw update using door_uploader tool for 50 times in a row. Also extensive communication testing shows no sign of D200 dropping or not responding to frames. 

It would be good to also check the AMC side that could there be some timing issue or race condition with the data frame response and heartbeat response handling from the D200.

fields.name: 16.10 - DOE - CAR Buzzer keeps shouting even when RDF is enabled, Randomly
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

16.10 - DOE - CAR Buzzer keeps shouting even when RDF is enabled

 

Parameters:  

 

Group configuration:

  • Simplex

 

Drive type:

  • KCEKDL 16S

 

Regression or new finding:

  • New Finding, AdHoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • PIO 1A, 3A, 4A
  • KNSMUL G24​​​​​​ (A & B) side​
  • 12 floor setup
  • TTC, Single, Dummy floors
  • KCE KDL 16S

 

  • Elevator in Normal Mode, Doors are closing
  • DOE B Enabled from PIO 1A's 19th Input
  • PIO 3A & 4A's 21st output - DOE*I indication turned ON  
  • PIO 3A & 4A's 17st output - BUZZER indication turned ON 
  • RDF is turned on (Along with DOE Enabled)
  • Buzzer keeps still shouting

 

 

Expected behavior:  

  • Buzzer should stop Shouting when any type of Inspection is enabled (RDF, CAR TOP INSPECTION)

 

Actual behavior:

  • Buzzer still shouts even when RDF is enabled

 

NOTE:

  • This Buzzer shouting scenario is happening randomly
  • This is happening 9/10  times,0
  • that 1/10 time, Buzzer is turned off After RDF is turned ON 

 

NOTE 2:

  • When DOE B (Button) is pressed continuously, 
  • Buzzer shouts without stopping in Inspection Mode


When in DOE S (Switch) is turned ON

  • Buzzer shouts as long as the Switch is ON
  • And stops shouting when Inspection mode is activated
  • After turning OFF RDF, Buzzer starts shouting again

 

NOTE 3:

  • This issue is noted in 16.6, 16.8 also
  • This issue is noted in KNSMUL signalization too
  • This issue is validated in other simulators too
  • Related Requirement - DOE - NEW - Jama Software

 

Recovery: 

  • Turning OFF DOE B or DOE S & RDF

 

 

Log attached Information:

  • LPA
  • Event Traffic
  • Elevator Backup

 

Note: 

  • Logs have attached with functionalities i.e., DOE B, DOE S for better distinguishing

fields.name: AMD D200 - After power up normal open & close speed is not happened
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

AMD D200 - After power up normal open & close speed is not happened

 

Parameters:

Single

KDM 40

 

Regression or new finding:

New Findings

KCE-TSTRN-3965366

 

Test step number:

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  1. Elevator is in Normal Mode, initially stationed at the 1st floor.

  2. A car call is given to the 4th floor from both A and B sides.

  3. Elevator travels to the 4th floor and the doors begin to open.

  4. During the door opening, perform a power cycle.

  5. After power is restored, the door closes at learning speed.

  6. Following that, the door opens and closes at slow speed.

 

Expected behavior:  

After that door starts opening/closing in normal speed once reference switch (closed end) been detected. 

 

Actual behavior:

Door open/close with slow speed only even reference switch been detected

 

Note : If you give a car call to another floor, after reaching the floor door start to open & close with normal speed

This issue has also been observed in the side opening door type in the FRD Rellab.

 

Logs added: PowerBreak_0/PowerBreak_1

AMC version 4.6.237.6968

fields.name: 16.10 - IC Card Reader 2.0 - Immediate Opposite Floor Side Locking after Swiping Manual Cards on One Side
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

16.10 - IC Card Reader 2.0 - Immediate Opposite Floor Side Locking after Swiping Manual Cards on One Side

 

Parameters:

995 (IC CARD LOCK) - 3

 

Group configuration:

Simplex

 

Drive type:

PDX 3.2

 

Regression or new finding:

Ad-HOC

 

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • IC Card Reader 2.0 
  • CPU SW LD - 16.10.1.1
  • 72 Floor TTC Setup
  • 3 IC Card Reader is used

 

 

  • Some Floors are locked using Hierarchical Card
  • 5th TTC Floor is locked on both sides
  • Manual Owner Swipe Cards Unlocks swiped floors for 5 seconds timeout & locks it back

 

 

 

  • 5A Manual Owner Card is swiped, 

 

 

  • 5B Manual Owner Card is swiped,

 This time 5B Floor unlocks, but LOCKS 5A immediately

 

 

  • After swiping 5B Manual card the Lock Timeout of 5A gets neutralized and immediately locked
  • Car calls couldn't be registered from KCOP or Conventional COP

 

  • This causes the A Sided passenger hard to register Car Call

 

 

Expected behavior:  

  • 5A Unlocking Timeout should wait for a whole 5 seconds to get Locked again & the Swiping of opposite Floor Manual Swipe card shouldn't interfere with the other side Floor Unlock Timeout 

 

Actual behavior:

  • 5A Manual Card Swiped
  • 5B Manual Card Swiped
  • 5A Unlock Timeout gets neutralized and locked back again
  • 5B Floor Unlocks 

 

 

Log attached Information:

  • LPA
  • Event Traffic
  • Elevator Backup

Note:
This is noted happening in 16.8 too

fields.name: KCE NA - When the Elevator in HAC mode and power break occurs, the CPUc takes approximately 2 minutes to power on.
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

When the Elevator in HAC mode and power break occurs, the CPUc takes approximately 2 minutes to power on.

 

Parameters:  

1312 = 2

1721 = 1

 

Drive Parameter

130 = 0

131 = 5

 

Group configuration:

Single elevator setup

 

Drive type:

KDX32 inbuild battery  - Sw version 25.25

 

Regression or new finding:

New finding

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Test Case Name: HAC NA - Basic

 

Test step number:

Step4

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

Detailed Scenario:

  1. Elevator in HAC mode at HAC Zone.
  2. Turn off the Elevator power, wait for approximately 8 seconds, and then turn the power back to ON state.
  3. After power restoration, the CPUc does not power ON immediately. i.e. CPUc main 24V LED remains OFF and turns ON only after a delay of approximately ~110 seconds.
  4. After that only CPUc powers ON, And Now Elevator remains in HAC mode and HAC drive is possible only in latest sw LD-17.0.0.10.

 

 

Observation in Other Inspection Mode:

  • When doing Manual power cycle done  both HAC and ToC behaved similarly: the CPUc 24V power did not restore immediately — it took approximately 2 minutes for CPU power ON state
  • When RDF power cycling working as expected,  CPUc 24V power restoring immediately.

 

Note:

Q220 + AUX Main Switch always ON position throughout the observation. Power cycle done from building side only.

 

 

 

Expected behavior:  

After power resume, CPUc should be power ON immediately, i.e. CPUc 24V main supply LED should be turn ON.

 

Actual behavior:

After power resume, CPUc does not power ON immediately, i.e. CPUc 24V main supply LED is turn OFF state until ~2minitues.

 

Recovery: 

After 2minitues automatically recovered.

  

Log attached Information:

CPU and Drive Logs attached.

 

Value-added information: 

When do the power cycle in HAC mode, HAC drive is not possible in software versions lower than LD-17.0.0.10.

In LD sw - 17.0.0.8 HAC drive failed after power cycle.

-

fields.name: 16.10 - KNSMUL KCOP - Index Value 2A not changed to 1A after RollCall
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

16.10 - KNSMUL KCOP - Index Value 2A not changed to 1A after Roll-Call

 

Group configuration:

Single

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

LD : 16.10.1.7
KNSMUL SW : 0.0.0.46

DIP - 11000001

2 x A sided MUL Boards connected (1A, 2A)

 

1A KCOP removed from LON
Roll Call Initiated

 

Expected behavior:  

2A KCOP Should be converted to 1A automatically

 

Actual behavior:

2A is shown instead of 1A

 

 

Recovery: 

When LD SW version is changed to 16.8 and reverted back to 16.10, This issue is solved

2A is converted to 1A

 

 

Log attached Information:

LPA

 

NOTE:

Function wise everything is working Fine in KCOP

But the Index value of the second MUL "2A" is not changed to 1A automatically when Roll Call performed without 1A

In LON Node Imager tool too it is shown as Index value 2

fields.name: 16.10 - TSCOP - 2nd Floor is automatically set as "UG" after installing WELM 0.0.0.62
fields.description:
Defect Description:

 

  • 24 Floor Single Sided Setup
  • 2 x 29" Marine TSCOP (Main & AUX)
  • LD :16.10.1.8
  • WELM : 0.0.0.62, 
  • Protocol SW : 0.0.0.13
  • KNSMUL SW : 0.0.0.47

 

  • Under Floor Related Settings, 
  • ”Yes” = floor data from RS-485

 

  • After installing WELM 0.0.0.62
  • 2nd floor is automatically labelled as "UG"

 

 

NOTE:

  • This is noted happening when WELM 0.0.0.61 is upgraded to 0.0.0.62
  • And this cannot be changed, floor 2 always sticks with "UG"
  • With WELM 0.0.0.61, This issue was not observed
  • This issue is happening for the first time after Updating from WELM 0.0.0.61 to 0.0.0.62
  • Strangely after that this issue is not reproduced
  • When manually changed the Floor Marking under  ->Floor Related Settings -> Floor Map -> Short Name to '2' , after restart Name is not Changed & sticked with "UG"
     

 

Recovery:

  • ​​​​​When manually changed the Floor Marking under (with WELM 0.0.0.62) ->Floor Related Settings -> Floor data from RS-485 set as "NO"
  • Restarted
  • Set Floor Related Settings -> Floor MAP -> Short name as nothing & Restarted, Issue Solved
  • And never reproduced again.
  • Video Attached for better understanding

 

LOGS:

  • TSCOP Logs & Video attached 

​​​​​

fields.name: PESSRAL4.4 - Elevator Inspection Overspeed Fault #1403 Triggered Only in REEO Mode
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

PESSRAL4.4 - Elevator Inspection Overspeed Fault #1403 Triggered Only in REEO Mode

 

Parameters:  

Safety Parameter 6016 =1 

 

Group configuration:

Single elevator setup

 

Drive type:

KDM90 

SW version - 25.11

 

Regression or new finding:

New finding 

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

Ad-hoc defect - While Execute the PESSRAL4.4 Testing 

 

Test step number:

Ad-hoc scenario

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

Scenario:

  1. Elevator in REEO mode (Additional RDF mode)
  2. Set KDM Drive Parameter 20 = 0.4 m/s (ProManager allowed range: 0.10 to 0.5 m/s).
  3. When run the REEO mode (Additional RDF run),  Inspection Mode Overspeed Fault #1403 activated when speed exceeds < 0.3 m/s
  4. But, when machine room Normal RDF run, no fault is triggered, and the inspection speed is maintained by ≥ 0.3 m/s.

 

Note:

Due to ProManager limitations, we are not able to verify action from other Kone drives.

 

Expected:

Both RDF runs should have the same behavior.

 

Actual behavior:

When run the REEO mode (Additional RDF run),  Inspection Mode Overspeed Fault #1403 activated when speed exceeds < 0.3 m/s

 

Recovery: 

NA 

 

Log attached Information:

Log attached

- TTS Log 

- Drive Log

- Event viewer log 

 

Value-added information: 

Tested with 

 

LD- 17.0.0.11

GCD - 17.0.0.8

KDM Drive sw - 25.11

Promanager version - 4.6.235

 

HW PESSRAL 4.4 supported (G30)

(e.g. URL link to requirement which is related to the defect)

fields.description:
Description:

5.1 - E-Link - Elevator Status Bar is not Froze in the Main Page when Scrolling down to lower Floors

 

  • E Link 5.1
  • Version 4.5.9
  • Total Shaft setup - 72 Floors

 

  • When Scrolled down, The Elevator Status Bar is scrolled Up along with the Floor Cells

 

 

  • From Customer, Service Person & Tester POV:
  • This makes it harder to view the Status of Lower Floors, if needed to check the Elevator status along the position of the Elevator
  • And each time it is required to scroll all the way up to check the Status

 

  • Even Set the Floor Height as "Very Low"

  • Still the status bar is not visible

 

  • This is not the case when checked with E Link NXT

  • When Scrolled Down to lower Floors, The Elevator Status Bar is Fixed & Froze

Scenario:

 

Under Drive Parameters

The Parameter is saved in the Background but not shown in the UI

fields.name: 17.0 - PAD O - Both Side Doors are not Parked Open in PAD Floor when Down Landing Call Button Direction is Locked
fields.description:
​​​Parameters:  

 

Group configuration:

Single

 

Drive type:

KDX 14

 

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

  • Elevator in other than PAD Floor (ADO Disabled)
  • After PAD Delay, Elevator starts to travel to PAD Floor (Which has B Side Down Landing Call Locked)
  • PAD Floor Reached with A side Doors alone Left Opened
  • B side Doors are in closed state (B side's CAR Call & Up Landing Call is in Unlocked state)
  • But when now UP Landing Call is pressed, B side Doors are Parked Open
  • This causes confusion, now PAD gives priority to unlocked Car Call & UP Landing Calls when Pressed
  • But when Elevator Automatically reaches PAD Floor, Doors are Not Parked Opened (This is happening Randomly, sometime both doors are parked opened)
    ​

Expected Scenario:

  • Since UP Landing Call is Unlocked, Registering UP Landing Call Causes the Lift go from "Vacant State" to "CAR Call Pref"
  • Which disables PAD Mode
  • Now Both Doors should Open & after then DOB Time out The locked Landing Call Floor should eventually Close the Door
  • But this is not happening, Doors are left opened!​​​​​

 

Log attached Information:

  • LPA
  • Event Traffic

fields.name: 17.0 - ACL - Elevator Door Signals flutters & gets Stuck when RDF is released after relevelling with ACL in PRC Mode
fields.description:
Parameter:


 

 

Detailed Description:

  • Single Elevator
  • 12 Floor Setup (TTC, Dummy & Staggered)
  • Drive - KDM 40
  • COP - KDS Signalization
  • OPT - 35 Connected 

 

  • Elevator in Vacant state (Normal Mode)
  • ACL mode is set to function with Doors Closed
  • PRC in CAR, PRC K (Continuous - Switch Key usage) is enabled
  • Both A & B Side doors are left opened
  • RDF Enabled
  • Floor Level is increased/decreased by 10mm (Floor level is adjusted by using SDS Shaft Tool)
  • RDF Turned OFF

 

Expected Scenario:

  • Since there is an offset with Floor Level, ACL Should be enabled after Closing the wide opened doors (Due to PRC C) 
  • After Relevelling, Doors should be again Left opened with PRC C enabled
     

Actual Scenario:

  • Doors are not Closed & Relevelled (CPU throws Open & Close signals continuously which causes the door to stay opened (in a vibrating manner))
  • Instead Doors get stuck forever with fluttering of Door Commands from the CPU

 

Recovery:

  • Triggering of any other Special Mode (Like FRD) will cancel out this fluctuation issue and makes the door Close Correctly
  • RDF - ON/OFF

Note:

  • This happens only when the ACL is set as 1 (ACL Doors Closed Enabled, Door opening after ACL)
  • When checked with ACL - 3 (ACL Doors Open Enabled) there is not Fluttering issue noted
  • This is happening Randomly, at times Doors are closed correctly but most time Fluttering of Door Signal is noted
  • Checked with 16.10, Same issue noted

 

 

LOGs:

  • Event Traffic
  • LPA
  • Elevator Backup
  • MP4 for better understanding

FRD IL-Lift does not return to Return Floor when DOB is pressed repeatedly

 

Parameters:  

1442 =22
1420 = 1

single elevator setup

PDX

New Finding

Ad-hoc

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

Elevator is at a non-return floor in normal mode with the door open.
FRD phase-1 is triggered through OPT(35).
While the door is closing, press the DOB button repeatedly (press → release → press).
The elevator keeps the door open for too long and does not proceed to the return floor.

 

Expected behavior:  

When the elevator is in phase-1 at a non-return floor, and the door has been open for more than the dwell time (exceeds 2 minutes), the door should close and the lift should move to the return floor, even if DOB is pressed repeatedly.

 

Actual behavior:

The elevator stays at the non-return floor for an extended period when the DOB button is pressed in pulses (press/release repeatedly).

fields.name: KCE 17.0.0.18 Unexpected Parameter 76 (Virtual Floor Setting) Appears in Drive Parameter Settings and Is Not Related to EZO
fields.description:
Detailed Defect Description:

 

While checking the drive parameter for EZO feature, an additional parameter 76 – Virtual Floor Setting is displayed. This parameter is not related to EZO functionality. Its presence may cause confusion for users configuring EZO-related parameters.

 

Parameters:  

NA

 

Group configuration:

single elevator setup

 

Drive type:

KDM 40 or KDM 90

 

Regression or new finding:

New finding

 

 

Test case Name / Feature name:

EZO feature (ad - hoc scenario)

 

Test step number:

ad-hoc scenario

 

Description of the test case (Detailed Scenario) 

 

  • Navigate to the Drive Parameter Settings screen.

  • Use the search bar to search for “Virtual Floor”.

  • Observe that all EZO-related parameters are displayed.

  • Along with these, an unknown parameter 76 with the description “Virtual Floor Setting” also appears, even though it is not related to EZO.

 

Expected behavior:  

Unknown parameters with EZO descriptions must not be displayed.

 

Only EZO-related parameters must be displayed (160,161,162 & 163)

 

 

Actual behavior:

When searching for “Virtual Floor” in the Drive Parameter Settings, all EZO-related parameters are displayed along with an unknown Parameter 76, which also shows a Virtual Floor Setting description, even though it is not related to EZO.

 

 

 

Recovery: 

NA

(e.g. Log attached information like KCEGC logs, N test, S test, CPU Logs, E-link play back file & - specific time to seen in log)

Roll Call Performed

After Completion of Roll Call, No Calls were registered

No Indications were shown
Complete TSCOP went not operable

Issue was still there

Same WELM Application SW 0.0.0.91 & Protocol SW 0.0.0.16 is reinstalled back again, TSCOP Works fine

fields.name: IoT – Software Update Fails (17.0.0.16 → 17.0.0.20)
fields.description:
Issue Description:
During the remote software update process from 17.0.0.16 to 17.0.0.20, the update fails immediately after initiation.
The system displays the following error message:

“Failed to initiate software update”

 

Observed Behavior:

  • Update request is triggered from the IoT Portal

  • Update moves to Initiating state

  • Fails within a few seconds

  • Error pop-up shown at portal side: “failed to initiate software update, rollback SW file not found”

  • No download attempt is made on the device

Expected Behavior:

  • Software update should be successfully initiated

  • Device should download the software package and proceed through normal update stages

Impact:

  • Remote Software Update (RSU) not functional for the affected device

  • Blocks regression testing for 17.0.0.20 release
